com.metsci.glimpse.support.shader.line

    • Field Detail

      • thickness_PX

        public float thickness_PX
        The thickness of the ideal bounds of the line. Feathering will encroach into these bounds, by half of feather_PX.

      • feather_PX

        public float feather_PX
        The thickness of the feather region, across which alpha fades to transparent. Half the feather thickness (the more opaque half) lies inside the ideal bounds of the line, and half (the more transparent half) lies outside.

        For feathering to work, GL.GL_BLEND must be enabled.

        Line rendering is likely to be faster with feather set to zero.

      • joinType

        public LineJoinType joinType
        How to join connected line segments. Defaults to NONE, which gives appearance and performance similar to familiar GL line drawing. Other join types may look nicer, but are more computationally expensive to render.

        Line rendering is likely to be faster with a join-type of NONE.

      • miterLimit

        public float miterLimit
        To keep miters from growing out of control for very sharp angles, miter joins are only used when:

        miterLength <= miterLimit * lineThickness

        where miterLength is the distance from the outer tip of the miter to its inner corner.

        Otherwise, a bevel join is used instead.

        Has no effect unless joinType is LineJoinType.JOIN_MITER.

      • rgba

        public float[] rgba
        The color used for the most opaque parts of the line. Due to feathering and/or stippling, some parts of the line may have their alpha values scaled down, so that they become more transparent.

      • stippleEnable

        public boolean stippleEnable
        Line rendering is likely to be faster with stippling disabled.

      • stippleScale

        public float stippleScale
        The number of pixels, along the length of the line, covered by one bit of stipplePattern.

      • stipplePattern

        public int stipplePattern
        Least significant bit is drawn at the start of the line. Despite the "int" type, only the bottom 16 bits are used. 1 = opaque, 0 = transparent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineStyle

        public LineStyle()

        public LineStyle(LineStyle source)
